question: [File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Byzantine: Timestamp Skew] Can Byzantine validators use significantly different timestamps to cause some batches to be considered expired on some nodes but not others? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Byzantine: Proof Forgery] If batch proofs can be forged with invalid signatures that still pass digest checks, can Byzantine validators include unbacked batches? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Byzantine: Double Batch Inclusion] Can the same batch be included in multiple forms (inline, opt, proof) within a single payload to bypass validation? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Byzantine: Channel Flooding] Can Byzantine nodes flood the commit_notifier channel with CommitNotification messages to prevent legitimate notifications from being processed? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Byzantine: Metrics Poisoning] Can Byzantine validators manipulate availability metrics to make honest validators appear to have low availability? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Byzantine: Transaction Filtering Evasion] Can Byzantine proposers craft inline transactions that evade block_transaction_filter detection through obfuscation or encoding tricks? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [DoS: Batch Count] Can a proposer include thousands of batches each with one transaction to exhaust memory during futures::future::join_all()? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [DoS: Transaction Size] Can extremely large transactions (near maximum allowed size) in inline batches cause memory exhaustion when cloned multiple times? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [DoS: Proof Set Size] Can a proposer create proof_with_data with thousands of proofs to exhaust memory during processing? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [DoS: Nested Iteration] In update_availability_metrics(), does chunk_by() with many unique authors cause O(nÂ²) behavior? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [DoS: Clone Amplification] If the same large transaction set is cloned multiple times (for publishing, inline extraction, etc.), can this amplify memory usage? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [DoS: Concurrent Fetches] Can a proposer trigger many concurrent batch fetches that exhaust network bandwidth or file descriptors? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Epoch: Validator Set Change] During epoch transitions when ordered_authors changes, can old batches reference validators no longer in address_to_validator_index? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Epoch: Pending Commits] If commit notifications are pending when epoch ends, can they be processed with wrong validator set information? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Epoch: Cached Batches] Are batches that span epoch boundaries properly invalidated, or can stale batches from previous epoch be executed? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Epoch: Config Migration] If enable_payload_v2 changes during epoch transition, can validators process same payload differently? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Epoch: Publisher Consistency] If maybe_consensus_publisher becomes None or Some during epoch transition, can this cause missing block propagation? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Partition: Split Availability] If network partitions cause different validators to have different batch availability, can check_payload_availability() results diverge? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Partition: Responder Subset] If only a subset of responders are reachable due to partition, can batch retrieval fail even though quorum exists? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Partition: Timestamp Divergence] Can network partitions cause validators to have different views of certified_timestamp, leading to different expiration decisions? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Partition: Commit Notification Delay] If coordinator_tx is blocked due to partition, can commit notifications be delayed indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Attack: Transaction Reordering] Across different payload types (InQuorumStore vs OptQuorumStore vs InlineHybrid), can transaction ordering differ, enabling MEV extraction? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Attack: Selective Transaction Inclusion] Can a proposer selectively include only profitable transactions by manipulating batch selection in OptQuorumStore? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Attack: Batch Front-Running] Can inline batches be used to front-run transactions in proof batches since they're processed first? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_manager/quorum_store_payload_manager.rs] [Attack: Gas Price Manipulation] Can max_txns_to_execute be set to favor high-gas transactions over low-gas ones, causing unfair transaction ordering? (Medium)
